name: Traditional Army
description: Our army has been transformed too much by our reliance on Russia. We should move to create a more traditional, organised army.

name: Private Noble Armies
description: The princes' guards should be transformed to a united princes' army, to protect princes and nobles from rebels and allow them to command their own troops.

name: Organise Nobles' Armies
description: The noble armies should be pushed more for organisation, and should increase recruitment to these armies, to increase employment and make our forces stronger.

name: Organise Main Army
description: The main army of Mongolia should not be forgotten. It must be organised, with many of the far away officers, sometimes acting as warlords, being dealt with.

name: Urga Military Council
description: Our planning ability is very poor currently, with no organisation between generals and military leaders. A military council in Urga should be formed to organise and plan this.

name: Militant Nation
description: We must transform Mongolia into a militant strong nationalist nation, to help defend our borders and protect Mongolians.

name: Review the Budget
description: Spending was increased massively under the regime of Ungern-Sternberg. Failed industrialisation schemes, poor army funding and paying off the Russian government has left the nation lacking money. We must decide what we are to do.

name: Continue the Status Quo
description: The status quo is what helps keep us in power. Traditionalism is the basis of Mongolia, and this should be continued and encouraged.

name: Cut Unnecessary Costs
description: It is clear that spending has become out of control under the Baron's rule. Though it will be hard, these cuts must be made.

name: Landowners Rights Act
description: Rights to landowners which we put into law during the chaos of the Western Revolt should be organised and increased into the Landowners Rights Act, giving landowners far reaching power.

name: Encourage Nomadism
description: Much of Mongolia's population is completely nomadic, moving around through the year rather than settling permanently. This idea is enshrined in Mongolian society, and people in the city should instead be encouraged to go out there, so they are easier to control.

name: Encourage Business Growth
description: Other than Russian business, the Baron's rule has starved us of foreign investment. We should encourage this if we are to survive and thrive in the modern world.

name: Dissolve Opposing Organisations
description: Since the chaos of the Western Revolt we have tolerated the existence of opposing organisations, but no more. We have secured our position enough to justify banning and dissolving these organisations.

name: Mongolian Traditionalism
description: Mongolian society is inherently traditionalist. This must be encouraged, to stop the calls for revolution.

name: Mongol Identity
description: In the past, Mongolia was a great empire covering the land. An identity of Mongolism, being an independent Mongol, must be encouraged.

name: Statue of the Khan
description: We as a nation must remember our history, and our greatest leader, Genghis Khan. He is a perfect example of the Mongol identity which we want to encourage. Therefore, a great statue of him should be constructed in Urga, to push this idea of Mongolism.

name: Eternal Independence
description: Mongolian people must always fight to be independent. We are at constant threat from the Chinese, and therefore every Mongol has the duty to protect the nation.

name: Mongolian Nationalism
description: Nationalism is a key part of our regime. The people must see themselves as great once again, and must be encouraged to protect the nation at all costs.

name: Remember Our History
description: To help push this nationalism to the people, it should be taught in schools about the key parts of all of our history.

name: Great Mongolian State
description: The independence of our Great Mongolian State is paramount. People must be willing to die for Mongolia!
